crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects script used in ransomware attacks exploiting and encrypting ESXi servers
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Florian Roth

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects attempts to clear logs on the system. Adversaries may clear system logs to hide evidence of an intrusion
Detects chmod targeting files in abnormal directory paths.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Indicator Removal on Host - Clear Mac System Logs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects deletion of local audit logs
Detect file time attribute change to hide new or changes to existing files

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert ( gid:122; sid:7; rev:2; msg:"(port_scan) TCP filtered portsweep"; metadata: rule-type preproc; classtype:attempted-recon;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: (stream_tcp) data sent on stream after TCP reset sent

attributes.magic: POSIX shell script, ASCII text executable

threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered ransomware. Other contributing factors were that it has known exploits and it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ai_results.analysis:
The script starts by setting limits on the number of processes and open files.

Next, it changes the configuration files of all running virtual machines to point to encrypted virtual disks.

Then, it kills the vmx process and encrypts all virtual disks using the provided public key.

After that, it replaces the index.html files of all VMware user interfaces with a custom version.

It also replaces the /etc/motd file with a custom version.

Next, it deletes all log files and waits for the encryption tasks to complete.

Finally, it removes the script and restarts the SSH service.
